thread.title: CORONA: 9 injured -- 3 critical -- in partial bridge collapse on 91 (UPDATE 2)
thread.title_full: CORONA: 9 injured -- 3 critical -- in partial bridge collapse on 91 (UPDATE 2) - Press Enterprise

author: ALI TADAYON
title: CORONA: 9 injured -- 3 critical -- in partial bridge collapse on 91 (UPDATE 2)
text:
ALI TADAYON / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 9, 2015 Updated: Oct. 10, 2015 11:29 a.m. CORONA: 9 injured -- 3 critical -- in partial bridge collapse on 91 (UPDATE 2) Print Photo Share Pin It 1 of 3 More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT A construction worker walks toward the site Saturday, Oct. 10, of a bridge collapse on the 91 Freeway near Corona. The partial bridge was under construction late Friday, Oct. 9, when the collapse occurred, injuring a number of workers on the scene. ALI TADAYON, STAFF Related article » Update on the number of workers injured and additional information.
Nine construction workers were injured Friday night, Oct. 9, after a partial bridge collapse at the 91 freeway undercrossing, transportation authorities said.
One worker has been released from the hospital, but three others are in critical condition, according to Eliza Echevarria, spokeswoman for the Riverside County Transportation Commission, in an updated news release sent Saturday morning.
All nine workers were hospitalized after the incident.
The workers were lowering the on-ramp into place about 11 p.m., the initial news release said. Something went wrong with the jacking operation, causing the bridge deck to drop about 16 inches. The bridge deck struck the wooden support beams, which hit the workers.
The 91 roadway remained open Saturday, but East Grand Boulevard was closed.
All injured workers are affiliated with the prime contractor Atkinson Walsh Construction Joint Venture, according to the Riverside County Transportation Commission.
As of Saturday morning, "the bridge is seated in the proper position and inspections of the bridge have been made by the project structural engineering team. The East Grand Boulevard roadway is being cleared, with the goal of restoring traffic on the roadway between Third Street and Joy Street as soon as possible. California Occupation Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) was on scene and has initiated its investigation," Echevarria wrote in the release.
As of 9:40 a.m., Joy Street and Third Street was still closed to traffic .
"The Riverside County Transportation Commission and the project team’s thoughts and prayers are with the injured workers and their families and ask that their privacy be respected. Project officials are continuing to monitor the condition of the construction workers," Echevarria wrote in the news release .
Transportation officials will make additional statements during an 11:30 a.m. press conference.
